Event.name: Hit_or_miss
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> succeeds or fails to interact perceptually or physically with the <fen>Target</fen> or <fen>Target_location</fen>. The <fen>Instrument</fen> which is used to interact with the <fen>Target</fen> may stand in metonymically for the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>At first <fex name="Agent">he</fex> shot <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>wide</t> <fex name="Target">of his target</fex> .</ex> <ex>Because I programmed the scope wrong , <fex name="Agent">I</fex> kept <t>missing</t> <fex name="Target">Jupiter</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">She</fex> scored two <t>hits</t> <fex name="Target_location">on the deer 's left side</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual who tries to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Target
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Target</fen> is the entity located in an indirectly accessible location relative to the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Outcome
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Outcome</fen> is the failure or success of an attempt at interaction, incorporated in the LUs of the frame. </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Agent</fen> achieves a <fen>Purpose</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the interaction takes place at the <fen>Target_location</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when something hits or misses.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>A description of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> manages or fails to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of how the details of the event compare to others, either generally (<ment>the same way</ment>), or in terms of a state of the <fen>Agent</fen> which influences the event (<ment>carelessly</ment>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to interact with the <fen>Target</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of <fen>Particular_iteration</fen> indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which contextualizes the hitting or missing of the <fen>Agent</fen> but is not conceived of as caused by it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The object manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Target_location
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location that the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to access using the <fen>Instrument</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The number of times that the <fen>Agent</fen> hits or misses the <fen>Target</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Deviation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The distance of the actual location from the <fen>Target_location</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: miss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fail to hit, reach, or come into contact with.

lexUnit.name: wide.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: far from a particular point or mark.

lexUnit.name: hit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of hitting or being hit.

lexUnit.name: bullseye.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the centre of the target in sports such as archery and darts.

lexUnit.name: hole in one.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a shot that enters the hole from the tee.
